definition: date of use (on foodstuffs)/best before date
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: All of our products have been tested to ensure a two-three-year shelf life .
sentences.chinese: 我们的所有产品都经过测试并保证两三年的保质期。

sentences.english: With the vacuum freeze-drying technology, it has longer quality-guaranteed period and better edible convenience.
sentences.chinese: 冷冻干燥工艺提高了产品的保质期，而且食用方便。

sentences.english: Sulfa drugs inhibit the growth and multiplication of certain bacteria by interfering with the synthesis of folic acid.
sentences.chinese: 抑制细菌繁殖，我们可以有效地延长酸奶保质期。

sentences.english: But for convenience and shelf life, use dried fruit as your back-up plan.
sentences.chinese: 但为了方便，保质期，你可以吧干果作为后备计划。

sentences.english: The awful realization that we've passed our sell-by dates.
sentences.chinese: 忽然意识到我们已经过了保质期了。

sentences.english: According to modified atmosphere packaging test analysed. some food storge life had been received.
sentences.chinese: 通过试验取得一些气调包装食品的保质期。

sentences.english: Passed SIRIM security, One Year Warranty.
sentences.chinese: 通过Sirim验证，享有一年保质期。

sentences.english: We can keep the milk for up to a year.
sentences.chinese: 母乳的保质期至多是一年。

sentences.english: She also said the shelf life of Tamiflu has been extended from five to seven years.
sentences.chinese: 她还说达菲的保质期已经从5年延长到了7年。

sentences.english: For example, she says it’s important to undertand how expiration dates work.
sentences.chinese: 例如，她说，弄清食品的保质期终止时间很重要。

sentences.english: How to organise your shopping and maximise the shelf life of fresh produce.
sentences.chinese: 如何组织您的购物并且尽量提高新鲜产品的保质期。

sentences.english: Please use this product in the effective shelf-life period .
sentences.chinese: 本产品请在有效保质期内使用。

sentences.english: A. Breakage and shelf life is a constant challenge.
sentences.chinese: 破损和保质期一直是我们不断要面临的挑战。

sentences.english: Second, make sure the condom has not reached its expiration date.
sentences.chinese: 第二，确保安全套没有过保质期。

sentences.english: The rice is said to last up to three weeks without spoiling after being cooked.
sentences.chinese: 据说这种米长达三个星期的保质期，煮熟后不会变质。

sentences.english: It's still under guarantee, so the manufacturer will repair it.
sentences.chinese: 它还在保质期内，所以厂商会给修理的。

definition: to be overdue/to exceed the time limit/to expire (as in expiration date)
to degenerate/to deteriorate/(of food) to go bad/to go off/(geology) metamorphism
loose goods/goods sold open/draft (of beer, as opposed to bottled)
